column4: I just finished compiling and installing kernel 2.6.20, but when I reboot my comp hangs at "Waiting for root file system." I googled around an discovered several threads started by people with the same problem. However, in their case they had SATA hard drives (hence the problem) I do not. I've followed the directions given by helpful people across the internet, but still can't reboot.
I've run into this problem before, but have never solved it. Each time I try, I just end up running out of time and booting into my old kernel
Anyone know what's going on with me? I'm desprate
I'm having some strange problems when trying to install the package I created for my compiled kernel: http://paste.uni.cc/13837
Couldn't find package update-grub ???
update-grub is part of grub package
But I have that installed... Why would it be bitching at me?
And shouldn't it be grub-update?
are you running update-grub?
I'm trying to install a new kernel. http://paste.uni.cc/13837
All of the error messages are there
ls /usr/sbin/update-grub
Not there
i386 arch edgy?
locate shows it at /sbin/update-grub

It doesn't complain the package doesn't exist, but "User postinst hook script [/usr/sbin/update-grub]  failed to execute: No such file or directory
Should I link it?
link to /sbin/update-grub from where it is looking?
